context_evidences: - Paul Charles, head of travel consultancy The PC Agency, said it could take at least two or three months to get through a nasty cocktail of staff shortages, COVID illness and a backlog in approving security passes for airport and airline workers. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/hit-by-staff-shortages-airlines-airports-struggle-with-travel-recovery-2022-04-05/ published on 2022-04-05 14:13:28

- Opting to go maskless will certainly have repercussions, and at this point, the resulting delays or cancellations may be more than the airline industry can handle. Over the past weekend, over 12,000 flights in the U.S. were delayed or cancelled due to a variety of factors, including poor weather, technology issues, and — you guessed it — staffing shortages. Reference: https://jalopnik.com/overseas-airlines-dropped-mask-mandates-now-theyre-bat-1848762415 published on 2022-04-07 11:00:00

- Biden's decision on masks may simply come down to those logistics alone to prevent further shortages in an already-slammed industry. Reference: https://jalopnik.com/overseas-airlines-dropped-mask-mandates-now-theyre-bat-1848762415 published on 2022-04-07 11:00:00

- But a combination of a tight labour market, delays in the security checks for new and returning staff as well as COVID-related absences could put some airports under strain. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/hit-by-staff-shortages-airlines-airports-struggle-with-travel-recovery-2022-04-05/ published on 2022-04-05 14:13:28
correction_response:
This tweet is accurate. After dropping mask requirements, airlines like EasyJet have experienced staff shortages due to increased COVID-19 cases. This has led to a significant increase in flight cancellations compared to pre-pandemic levels. The staff shortages are not solely due to COVID-19, but also due to a tight labor market and delays in security checks for new and returning staff. The situation serves as a crucial consideration for the U.S. as it contemplates lifting federal airline mask mandates. 
References: 
https://jalopnik.com/overseas-airlines-dropped-mask-mandates-now-theyre-bat-1848762415 
https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/hit-by-staff-shortages-airlines-airports-struggle-with-travel-recovery-2022-04-05/
note_1_text: This is a screen shot of a real article, though one about UK airlines, including EasyJet, that lifted mask mandates in March. Between March 28 and April 3, EasyJet cancelled 202 flights due to staffing shortages. https://www.cbsnews.com/news/airlines-face-mask-covid-rules-flights-canceled/
note_2_text: This article pre-dates the lifting of the mask mandate in the U.S. This tweet is falsely claiming that the lifting of the U.S. mask mandate gave rise to cases, which would not be possible as the mandate has only been lifted for less than 24 hours now.

refute_evidences: - Masks have not been required on flights operated by budget-friendly, Swiss airline EasyJet since March 27, the airline said in a statement. The move came after the UK removed all travel restrictions earlier in March. [...] Between March 28 and April 3, EasyJet cancelled 202 of its 3,517 flights scheduled to depart from the UK, according to data provided to CBS MoneyWatch from Cirium, an aviation analytics company. By comparison, the carrier cancelled zero flights departing from the UK during the same period in 2019, before the pandemic. An EasyJet spokesperson attributed the increase in cancelled flights to “higher than usual staff sickness levels” due to a recent surge in COVID-19 cases across Europe. Reference: https://jalopnik.com/overseas-airlines-dropped-mask-mandates-now-theyre-bat-1848762415 published on 2022-04-07 11:00:00

- This could serve as a crucial tipping point for the Biden administration in the U.S. Right now, our federal airline mask mandates are set to lift on April 18, and airline CEOs have been mounting pressure to convince the government to reconsider a renewal or extension of the mandates. Reference: https://jalopnik.com/overseas-airlines-dropped-mask-mandates-now-theyre-bat-1848762415 published on 2022-04-07 11:00:00

- Thousands of holidaymakers have seen their Easter getaways disrupted or cancelled because airlines and airports do not have enough staff to meet the recovery in demand as pandemic restrictions are eased in Europe. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/hit-by-staff-shortages-airlines-airports-struggle-with-travel-recovery-2022-04-05/ published on 2022-04-05 14:13:28

- High rates of COVID-19 in Britain have caused staff absences for airlines and airports that were already struggling to recruit after workers deserted the industry during the pandemic. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/hit-by-staff-shortages-airlines-airports-struggle-with-travel-recovery-2022-04-05/ published on 2022-04-05 14:13:28
